Definition of the variable: Unique ID identifies each unique film. If a film appeared in more than one sample festivals, it will be assigned one unique ID, regardless of the number of appearances and screenings.
Data Source: ID was assigned during data processing
Coding: numeric and text data
Source of missing values: no missing data

Definition of the variable: If available, ID assigned by the International Movie database as of December 2020.
Data Source: Created after identification of films on IMDb
Coding: numeric and text data
Source of missing values: films not identified on IMDb

Definition of the variable: Film ID identifies each film appearance without differentiating unique films. 593 films (6 %) were identified in more than one sampled festival program (e.g., a film was shown at Berlinale and Clermont-Ferrand).
Data Source: ID was assigned during data processing
Coding: numeric and text data
Source of missing values: no missing values

Definition of the variable: Title of the film as appeared in the program (i.e., while most of the titles are in english, it can also be in other languages).
Data Source: Title identified in the given festival program
Coding: title as identified in the given festival program
Source of missing values: no missing data

Definition of the variable: Year of production, if the range of years is indicated - the year when the production was finished.
Data Source: Recoded based on the original production year indicated in the festival program, if the range (instead of one year) is used, use the latest year
Coding: year
Source of missing values: production year not indicated in the festival program

Definition of the variable: Indicator if a film is short, long, or interactive.
Data Source: Recoded based on information in the festival program (film length, sections, summaries)
Coding: for interactive films "does not apply", for shorts "40 min. or shorter", for long "41 min. or longer"
Value ranges: 40 min. or shorter; 41 min. or longer; does not apply
Source of missing values: no data on length in the festival program

Definition of the variable: Film length in minutes
Data Source: Film length as indicated in the festival program
Coding: minutes
Source of missing values: no data on length in the festival program

Definition of the variable: English name of the country of production as listed in the program as #1
Data Source: Standardized English names based on festival programs
Coding: country names
Source of missing values: no country of production listed in the program, short or interactive videos only.

Definition of the variable: English name of the country of production as listed in the program as #2
Data Source: Standardized English names based on festival programs
Coding: country names
Source of missing values: no second production country listed

Definition of the variable: English name of the country of production as listed in the program as #3
Data Source: Standardized English names based on festival programs
Coding: country names
Source of missing values: no third production country listed

Definition of the variable: English name of the country of production as listed in the program as #4
Data Source: Standardized English names based on festival programs
Coding: country names
Source of missing values: no fourth production country listed

Definition of the variable: English name of the country of production as listed in the program as #5
Data Source: Standardized English names based on festival programs
Coding: country names
Source of missing values: no fifth production country listed

Definition of the variable: English name of the country of production as listed in the program as #6
Data Source: Standardized English names based on festival programs
Coding: country names
Source of missing values: no sixth production country listed

Definition of the variable: English name of the country of production as listed in the program as #7
Data Source: Standardized English names based on festival programs
Coding: country names
Source of missing values: no seventh production country listed

Definition of the variable: Indicator if a country belongs to MENA region based on https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/906519-world-bank-country-and-lending-groups. Countries in the sample included: Algeria, Bahrain, Egypt, Iran, Iraq, Israel, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Morocco, Oman, Palestinian Territories, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, Syria, Tunisia, United Arab Emirates.
Data Source: Recoded based on prod.country1-7
Coding: 1 - at least one of production countries is included in MENA, 0 - none of the production countries is included in MENA
Source of missing values: no country of production listed in the program

Definition of the variable: Indicator if a country belongs to OCEANIA region based on https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/906519-world-bank-country-and-lending-groups. Countries included: Australia, Fiji, Guam, New Zealand.
Data Source: Recoded based on prod.country1-7
Coding: 1 - at least one of production countries is included in OCEANIA, 0 - none of the production countries is included in OCEANIA
Source of missing values: no country of production listed in the program

Definition of the variable: Indicator if a country belongs to Subsaharan Africa region based on https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/906519-world-bank-country-and-lending-groups. Countries included: Benin, Burkina Faso, Cameroon, Chad, Congo - Brazzaville, Côte d’Ivoire, Ethiopia, Ghana, Kenya, Madagascar, Mali, Mauritius, Mozambique, Nigeria, Senegal, South Africa, Tanzania, Uganda.
Data Source: Recoded based on prod.country1-7
Coding: 1 - at least one of production countries is included in Subsaharan Africa, 0 - none of the production countries is included in Subsaharan Africa
Source of missing values: no country of production listed in the program

Definition of the variable: Indicator if a country belongs to Asian and Central Asian region based on https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/906519-world-bank-country-and-lending-groups. Countries included: Afghanistan, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, Cambodia, China, Cyprus, Georgia, India, Indonesia, Japan, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Laos, Malaysia, Myanmar (Burma), Nepal, North Korea, Pakistan, Philippines, Samoa, Singapore, South Korea, Sri Lanka, Taiwan, Thailand, Turkey, Uzbekistan, Vietnam.
Data Source: Recoded based on prod.country1-7
Coding: 1 - at least one of production countries is included in Asia, 0 - none of the production countries is included in Asia
Source of missing values: no country of production listed in the program

Definition of the variable: Indicator if a country belongs to North American region based on https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/906519-world-bank-country-and-lending-groups. Countries included: Bermuda, Canada, United States.
Data Source: Recoded based on prod.country1-7
Coding: 1 - at least one of production countries is included in North America, 0 - none of the production countries is included in North America
Source of missing values: no country of production listed in the program

Definition of the variable: Indicator if a country belongs to European region based on https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/906519-world-bank-country-and-lending-groups. Countries included: Albania, Armenia, Austria, Belarus, Belgium, Bosnia & Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czechia, Denmark, France, Estonia, Faroe Islands, Finland, Germany, Greece, Iceland, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Kosovo, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Lithuania, Macedonia, Montenegro, Malta, Moldova, Monaco, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Russia, Serbia, Slovakia, Slovenia, Sweden, Switzerland, Spain, Ukraine, United Kingdom, Czechoslovakia, German Democratic Republic, North Macedonia.
Data Source: Recoded based on prod.country1-7
Coding: 1 - at least one of production countries is included in Europe, 0 - none of the production countries is included in Europe
Source of missing values: no country of production listed in the program

Definition of the variable: Indicator if a country belongs to Latin America and the Caribbean region based on https://datahelpdesk.worldbank.org/knowledgebase/articles/906519-world-bank-country-and-lending-groups. Countries included: Argentina, Aruba, Bahamas, Bolivia, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, Cuba, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras, Jamaica, Mexico, Nicaragua, Panama, Paraguay, Peru, Puerto Rico, Trinidad & Tobago, Uruguay, Venezuela.
Data Source: Recoded based on prod.country1-7
Coding: 1 - at least one of production countries is included in Latin_America_and_the_Caribbean, 0 - none of the production countries is included in Latin_America_and_the_Caribbean
Source of missing values: no country of production listed in the program

Definition of the variable: First and last name of a director listed as #1
Data Source: As listed in the given festival program
Coding: first and last name of the director listed as #1, as listed in the program
Value ranges: First and last name of the director listed as #1, as listed in the program
Source of missing values: if no data on director names listed in the program

Definition of the variable: First and last name of a director listed as #2-#26
Data Source: As listed in the given festival program
Coding: first and last name of the director listed as #2-#26, as listed in the program
Value ranges: First and last name of the director listed as #2-#26, as listed in the program
Source of missing values: if no director.2-director.26 listed in the program

Definition of the variable: Variable that indicates genre
Data Source: Mutually exclusive genre categories based on infomration in the festival program (genre, festival section, summary)
Coding: mutually exclusive text categories
Value ranges: animation documentary; animation fiction; experimental documentary; experimental fiction; other documentary; other fiction
Source of missing values: no data on genre available  in the program

Definition of the variable: Indicates, if film's genre is animation.
Data Source: Recoded based on infomration in the festival program (genre, festival section, summary)
Coding: 1 - film's genre includes animation; 0 - film's genre does not include animation
Source of missing values: no data on genre available  in the program

Definition of the variable: Film's genre is documentary
Data Source: Recoded based on infomration in the festival program (genre, festival section, summary)
Coding: 1 - film's genre includes documentary; 0 - film's genre does not include documentary
Source of missing values: no data on genre available  in the program

Definition of the variable: Film's genre is experimental
Data Source: Recoded based on infomration in the festival program (genre, festival section, summary)
Coding: 1 - film's genre includes experimental; 0 - film's genre does not include experimental
Source of missing values: no data on genre available  in the program

Definition of the variable: Film's genre is fiction
Data Source: Recoded based on infomration in the festival program (genre, festival section, summary)
Coding: 1 - film's genre includes fiction; 0 - film's genre does not include fiction
Source of missing values: no data on genre available  in the program

Definition of the variable: Indicates, if film's topic is LGBT*Q
Data Source: We have completed the festival program information with additional data. As an indicator for such films, we used the following variables as a proxy: 1. films sampled from Frameline; 2. films with LGBT*Q topics in the title; 3. for films available on IMDb, we have searched for LGBT*Q cues in the keywords; 4. and we have searched our films among films nominated for Teddy Award and Queer palm, prizes for LGBT*Q films.
Coding: 1 - film is on LGBT*Q topic; 0 - film is on a different topic
Source of missing values: no missing data

Definition of the variable: Festival from which the film was sampled
Data Source: Data comes from the festival programs (online of offline) used to collect the original data
Coding: BERLINALE; CANNES; CLERMONT-FERRAND; FRAMELINE; IDFA; TIFF
Value ranges: BERLINALE; CANNES; CLERMONT-FERRAND; FRAMELINE; IDFA; TIFF
Source of missing values: no missing data

Definition of the variable: If film was sampled from more than one festival, the first (chronologically) festival sample. For other films, the variable is the sample as variable"fest."
Data Source: Data comes from the festival programs (online of offline) used to collect the original data
Coding: BERLINALE; CANNES; CLERMONT-FERRAND; FRAMELINE; IDFA; TIFF
Value ranges: BERLINALE; CANNES; CLERMONT-FERRAND; FRAMELINE; IDFA; TIFF
Source of missing values: no missing data

Definition of the variable: Festival section
Data Source: Section of the give festival where the film ran identified in the festival program, as it is stated in the data source (no standardisation).
Coding: Names of the festival sections as originally stated
Value ranges: Names of the festival sections as originally stated
Source of missing values: no data on the section found

Definition of the variable: If film was sampled from more than one festival, the first (chronologically) festival section. For other films, the variable is the sample as variable"fest.sect"
Data Source: Section of the give festival where the film ran identified in the festival program
Coding: Names of the festival sections as originally stated
Value ranges: Names of the festival sections as originally stated
Source of missing values: no data on the section found

Definition of the variable: Year the sample festivals takes place (festival edition)
Data Source: Year of the festival edition
Source of missing values: no missing data

Definition of the variable: If film was sampled from more than one festival, the first (chronologically) festival edition year. For other films, the variable is the sample as variable"fest.sect"
Data Source: Year of the festival edition
Source of missing values: no missing data

Definition of the variable: Indicates if film was included in competition
Data Source: Recoded based on festival section data (not all sample festivals have competition section).
Coding: 1 - film is in competition; 0 - film is not in competition
Source of missing values: no missing data

Definition of the variable: Indicates of film's festival section is dedicated to retrospective films
Data Source: Recoded based on festival section data
Coding: 1 - film is in a retrospective section; 0 - film is not in a retrospective section
Source of missing values: no missing data

Definition of the variable: Indicates if film was shown at a festival sample 3 years or later after ist indicated rpoduction year
Data Source: Recoded based on production year and sample year data
Coding: 1 - film was shown 3 or more years after production; 0 - film was shown within the first three years after production.
Value ranges: 1 - film was shown 3 or more years after production; 0 - film was shown within the first three years after production.
Source of missing values: no missing data

Definition of the variable: Variable indicating if film has festival data available on IMDb (as not all IMDb accounts are complete and have festival data) as of December 2020
Data Source: Created based on IMDb sample
Coding: 1 - film has festival data in the IMDb sample; 0 - film does not have any festival data in the IMDb sample (although IMDb account/ID may exist)
Source of missing values: no missing data
